ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_rainbow] What's going on?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hiya, Why are we receiving email from a list called gay48@yahoogroups.com? Well Yahoo bought egroups and onelist, and in the process it seems they came up with
ygData.messageBody:
Hiya,

Why are we receiving email from a list called gay48@yahoogroups.com? Well
Yahoo bought egroups and onelist, and in the process it seems they came up
with aliases for all the lists.

It looks like we have been classified as a 'gay' list (sure) and that
emails to this group can also be sent to gay48. Why would they do this?
Probably to enable approved advertisers to better target their audiences.
I.E. advertisers who want to email the gay groups can email gay1, gay2,
gay3....and so on.

As long as Yahoo lets us ban individual email addresses, like
gayromance2001@..., I find this annoying but not a critical issue.

- Christina

On Thu, 14 Jun 2001, Sandy Collier wrote:

> Christina,
>
> I don't know why, but your email came to ME. It says to Gay48, but
> I've never registered under anything like that. I am on Rodcet and am
> Gaiwan/Gotham/Greymaulkin. What seems to be going on with it?
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Christina [mailto:tina@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 6:48 PM
> To: gay48
> Subject:
>
>
>
> Ok I am looking into banning this specific email address....
>
> If Yahoo won't let me ban this I will move the list to another provider.
>
> - Christina
